basics.name: Nurit Kirshenbaum
basics.label: Junior Researcher
basics.summary: I am a Junior Researcher (post-doc) in the Computer Sciences department at the University of Hawaii. I work with Jason Leigh in the Laboratory for Advanced Visualizations and Applications.

education.institution: Tel Aviv University, Tel Aviv, Israel

work.company: Laboratory of Advanced Visualizations and Applications (LAVA)
highlights: Develop products in the Lab's scope of interests.
Design and conduct user studies on Lab's projects.
Assist in demonstrating and advocating Lab's products.

work.summary: ICS 461 Artificial Intelligence, ICS 465 Introduction to Hypermedia, ICS 425 Computer Security and Ethics, ICS 485 Video Game Design and Development, ICS 426 Computer System Security, ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science I
highlights: Conduct recitations
Write quiz and homework materials
Manage class website
Assist students during office hours and grade assignments

work.company: University of Hawaii at West Oahu
work.summary: CM 315 Interactive Applications, CM 342 Applied Game Design
highlights: Plan out the courses.
Write materials/ prepare videos.
Conduct classes.
Help students with their projects and grade their work
Participate in running research and writing the subsequent article.
Review literature for research.
Write project proposal for IRB committee.
Develop solutions for fast paper-to-EBook conversions for book series (Falcon Guide imprint).
Explore enhanced user experience with digital books (using tools like iAuthor widgets).
Ran a CSS workshop.
Assisted in the creation of the iPad choose your own adventure game “The Guardians”
Maintain and create content for the company websites and the company blog.
Sketch technical drawings for custom fixtures.

work.company: Century 21 Kennedy, Ryan, Monigal and Assoc
highlights: Designed and produced marketing materials for an office with 25 agents.
Coordinated marketing over the Internet and kiosk TV.

work.company: University of Chicago School Mathematics Project
highlights: Create technical art to help portray mathematical theory and problems.
Edited manuscripts.
Designed and wrote the code for a software component to work within the CodeWarrior IDE.
Worked in accordance with software development practices, for design, testing and peer review.
Coded a complex GUI (Graphical User Interface) in Visual C++.
Creating the environments used for simulations of hardware under development.
Writing in a specialized computer language for this purpose - “E”
